article_title: Hardeep Singh: The Battle Against Misdiagnosis
article_text: There are times when a single, unexpected death sparks a change in medical practice. In 2012 a 12-year-old boy named Rory Staunton died after being misdiagnosed in a New York City emergency room. Multiple physicians missed the symptoms, signs and lab results pointing to a streptococcal bacterial infection that led to septic shock and overwhelmed Rory's body. The tragedy prompted New York state in January 2013 to introduce "Rory's regulations," a set of stringent protocols aimed at preventing similar incidents in...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Hardeep Singh writes that American doctors make the wrong call more than 12 million times a year.
twitter.title: The Battle Against Misdiagnosis

The tragedy prompted New York state in January 2013 to introduce "Rory's regulations," a set of stringent protocols aimed at preventing similar incidents in...
In 2012 a 12-year-old boy named Rory Staunton died after being misdiagnosed in a New York City emergency room.
There are times when a single, unexpected death sparks a change in medical practice.
Multiple physicians missed the symptoms, signs and lab results pointing to a streptococcal bacterial infection that led to septic shock and overwhelmed Rory's body.
